    public class HomeScreenActivity
extends android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity

    Home Screen Activity

    The Home Screen Activity is in charge of displaying a user log in questionnaire of three input fields: username, password and server IP address. The username and password will be verified with the server by communicating at given server IP address.

    Home Screen Activity must keep in memory the given user information if requested.

    Since:
    2018-04-12
    Version:
    0.0
    Author:
    FÃ©lix Boulet, Charles Hosson

      • HomeScreenActivity

    • Method Detail

      • handleLogin

        public void handleLogin()
        This method is responsible of parsing and verifying the user input in the fields of the log in questionnaire. If something is missing or the IP address format is invalid, a error message will be displayed so the user can correct is input. Else, the login request will be send to the server by calling the sendLoginRequest(inputs) private method.

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity

      • sendLoginRequest

        private void sendLoginRequest(HomeScreenActivity.HomeScreenInputs inputs)
        This method is responsible of sending the log in request to the server using the inputs provided in arguments.
        Parameters:
        inputs - HomeScreenInputs composed of three strings: username, password and IP serverAddress.

      • onResume

        protected void onResume()
        Overrides:
        onResume in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity

      • getErrorMsg

        private java.lang.String getErrorMsg(com.android.volley.VolleyError error)
        This method unwraps a REST error by transforming a VolleyError code into a legible string.
        Parameters:
        error - VolleyError to be decrypted.
        Returns:
        string containing error in a legible form.

      • getRetardedErrorMsg

        private java.lang.String getRetardedErrorMsg()
        This method chooses a retarded error msg from the table of dummy error msgs.
        Returns:
        string containing dummy error in a legible form.

      • loadCachedInputs

        private HomeScreenActivity.HomeScreenInputs loadCachedInputs()
        This method loads the previous user inputs according to the user preferences. Every input the user wants to be remembered by the app is loaded.
        Returns:
        HomeScreenInputs containing three strings: username, password, IP serverAddress.

      • saveInputs

        private void saveInputs(HomeScreenActivity.HomeScreenInputs inputs)
        This method saves the current user inputs according to the user preferences. Every input the user wants to be remembered by the app is saved.
        Parameters:
        inputs - HomeScreenInputs containing three strings: username, password, IP serverAddress.

      • setTextInputs

        private void setTextInputs(HomeScreenActivity.HomeScreenInputs inputs)
        This method writes the inputs passed in argument into the corresponding fields of the log in questionnaire.
        Parameters:
        inputs - HomeScreenInputs containing three strings: username, password, IP serverAddress.

      • getTextInputs

        private HomeScreenActivity.HomeScreenInputs getTextInputs()
        This method reads the input fields of the log in questionnaire and save each string into the corresponding HomeScreenInputs string.
        Returns:
        HomeScreenInputs containing three strings: username, password, IP serverAddress.
